isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - IC BUS SERVICE MANUAL - WINDOWS - REMOVAL PROCEDURE FOR STATIONARY GLASS

svcproc.title: REMOVAL PROCEDURE FOR STATIONARY GLASS

warning.para: Always wear eye protection and other safety equipment when handling glass to minimize the risk of injury.

svcproc.para: If the glass is broken, it may already have fallen or been removed from the rubber gasket ( Figure 58). It is often necessary to remove cracked or otherwise imperfect glass that is still intact. In this case, it is a good practice to criss-cross the glass with strips of masking tape before removal. This will help hold the glass together and minimize the risk of injury.

step1.para: Remove the lace rubber from the rubber gasket by prying out the edge of the lace rubber from the groove and continue to peel out the rubber.
For easy removal, insert a putty knife between the rubber gasket and the glass to break the sealant seal, making sure the glass is not stuck.
Repeat step two on the other side of the glass.
Position an assistant outside the vehicle at the glass.
From inside the bus, push the glass from the rubber seal
Have the assistant remove the glass and discard.
